newsitem.title: JAPAN: Kansai Elec sees 16.9% capacity growth by 2006/07.
newsitem.headline: Kansai Elec sees 16.9% capacity growth by 2006/07.

text.p: Kansai Electric Power Co Inc expects its power generating capacity to increase by 16.9 percent by fiscal 2006/2007, according to the company's newly revised 10-year outlook released on Friday.
Japanese electric utilities revise their long-term outlook annually at the end of every fiscal year.
The Osaka-based power utility said it expects its power generating capacity to amount to 43.34 million kilowatts (kw) by the end of March 2007.
Its power generating capacity is expected to total about 37.05 million kw at the end of this March.
Power output generated by its nuclear plants is expected to remain unchanged at 9.77 million kw during that period.
A breakdown of Kansai Electric's plans for power generation facilities follows (in 10,000 kilowatts):
